intro.description: Add a Ruby Runtime component (binary, or built from c-source) by using content assist.

item.title: Edit the component's name
item.description: The name of the unit should be the fully qualified name expected by the system.

subitem.label: Modify the "componentName" to reflect the name of the built component.

item.title: Edit the component's version
item.description: The component's version should reflect the wanted version of the component (typically a rpm:version).

subitem.label: Modify the rpm version specification after the 'rpm:' version type prefix.

item.title: Edit the component's location.
item.description: The source location of the native unit should be a URI (URL) where the c-source can be obtained. Alternatively, the location of the binary RPM.

subitem.label: Modify the 'componentURI' to reflect where the c-source or binary RPM can be fetched.
Press TAB to finish the templates.

item.title: Optionally change type to binary.
item.description:
If the source location is a reference to a binary RPM, the text inserted by the template must be edited to remove the statement that the unit represents something built from CSource.
Modify the part 'is RubyRuntime, CSource' by removing the comma and 'CSource'
